item.description:

item.title: Suspect car is abandoned., 18th December
item.description:
We have checked in the road, it hasn’t moved for two weeks, no one knows who it belongs to. We are unable to turn right out of our driveway as slightly overhangs and is quite difficult to get out when there are other parked cars opposite and on the other side of the driveway. Car Registration YC57MVP. It is taxed and has Mot but websites indicate it may be stolen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clive Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Worn parking bay demarcation lines, 18th December
item.description:
Parking bay demarcation lines are worn away or partially worn in Willow street nearing the Mawney road end. Parking wardens are rarely seen and or do not take sufficient action on illegal parking and or vehicles displaying fraudualent diabled badges or are not entitled to display thereoff etc. Parking wardens meant to ensure that also those people / parents who park their vehicles in Willow street during the school drop off and pickup times, are allowed to park there, and if not they meant to issue an fine for illegal parking. Parking wardens have been seen not issueing tickets to certain people but issueing tickets to people they don't know etc. (all caught on local cctv camera's). I there's no improvement on the above mentioned issues, obtained cctc footage will be released online on various social media apps and on various online outlets (YouTube / Tiktok etc.) .
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken service cover, 18th December
item.description:
This defect has been there for months. It is on the bend in Woolwich Rd near Garden Avenue. To avoid it (and damage to our car) you have to drive on the wrong side of the road. if you do not you risk damaging your tyres/wheels.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Avenue, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.title: Street lamps off for over a year!! Sort it out!, 18th December
item.description:
A number of street lamps on the pathway to Sainsbury's from Monclar road are not working and it is pitch black. It is really dangerous for accidents but also for personal safety - children walking from school feeling unsafe, wheelchair users and other vulnerable groups cannot see the path. Please respond, nothing has been done for over a year. Now more lights are off making it even more dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monclar Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements and road edge full of litter creating surface water accumalation, 18th December
item.description:
The road edge and pavements at this end of Roydene has not been cleaned for a while and there is small litter everywhere. The street sweepers just do the bare minimum. Vans and other worker vehicles constantly throwing rubbish on the pavements and blocking street edges.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Parkdale Road, Plumstead
